newsitem.title: UK: June could be wettest this century in Britain.
newsitem.headline: June could be wettest this century in Britain.

text.p: The Meteorological Office said on Monday that this month could be the wettest June this century in England and Wales.
With 24 hours left, 126.5 mm of rain had fallen, just 2.5 mm below the record set in June 1982. June is already the wettest month since January 1995.
The period between April 1995 and March 1997 was the driest 24-month period for more than 200 years. The bad weather this month has disrupted major sporting events and led to localised flooding.
